Name: Lewis Burwell Chesty Puller
Notes: Resigned from VMI after freshman year to enlist as a private in the U.S. Marine Corps in 1918 ; became lieutenant general and most decorated Marine in U.S. history

Name: Edward M. Almond
Notes: Commander of U.S. Army X Corps during Korean War

Name: Mel Brooks
Notes: During World War II , the U.S. Army used VMI to give technical education and training to soldiers who did not matriculate as cadets nor live within the VMI cadet system . Before becoming a filmmaker , he trained at VMI for 12 weeks

Name: James E. Brown III
Notes: Fellow and past president of Society of Experimental Test Pilots and Fellow of Royal Aeronautical Society

Name: William A . Brown
Notes: U.S. Navy vice admiral , Deputy Commander , United States Transportation Command ( USTRANSCOM )

Name: Josiah Bunting III
Notes: Superintendent of VMI , 1995-2002 ; Rhodes Scholar ; author

Name: Withers Burress
Notes: Professor of Military Science and Tactics at VMI ; Commanding General , U.S. Army 100th Infantry Division

Name: Harry F. Byrd Jr
Notes: Senator from Virginia ( 1965-83 )

Name: Richard E. Byrd
Notes: U.S. Navy rear admiral , polar explorer , Medal of Honor recipient ( 1926 )

Name: Tom C. Clark
Notes: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States ( 1949-67 ) , United States Attorney General ( 1945-49 )

Name: Dabney Coleman
Notes: Movie and television actor

Name: Harold Coyle
Notes: U.S. Army major ; novelist

Name: Charles Allen Culberson
Notes: U.S . Senator ; Governor of Texas

Name: Samuel C. Cumming
Notes: Decorated USMC Major General during World War II

Name: Jonathan Myrick Daniels
Notes: American civil rights activist and one of fifteen modern-day Anglican Church martyrs

Name: James U. Downs
Notes: Senior resident superior court judge in western North Carolina , 1983-2013 ; lawyer in Hickory and Franklin , North Carolina

Name: Richard Thomas Walker Duke
Notes: Confederate Colonel ; Member of U.S. House of Representatives and Virginia House of Delegates

Name: Edward Edmonds
Notes: Confederate Colonel of the 38th Virginia Infantry , killed-in-action during Pickett 's Charge

Name: John D. Ewing
Notes: Publisher of Shreveport Times , 1931-52

Name: Moses Jacob Ezekiel
Notes: Sculptor
